sect2.title: Introduction to libmpeg3
sect2.para: Libmpeg3 supports advanced editing and manipulation of MPEG streams.

sect2.title: Installation of libmpeg3
sect2.para: Install libmpeg3 by running the following commands:

userinput.command: patch -Np1 -i ../libmpeg3-&libmpeg3-version;-gcc34-1.patch && make && make install && cp i686/libmpeg3.a /usr/lib && cp {libmpeg3,mpeg3private,mpeg3protos}.h /usr/include

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: cp i686/libmpeg3.a /usr/lib && cp {libmpeg3,mpeg3private,mpeg3protos}.h /usr/include: Since make install doesn't copy the library and header files to proper locations, it is done manually.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The libmpeg3 package provides the libmpeg3 library, mpeg3cat, mpeg3dump and mpeg3toc utilities.

sect3.title: libmpeg3
sect3.para: libmpeg3 decodes several MPEG standards into uncompressed data suitable for editing and playback.

sect3.title: mpeg3cat
sect3.para: mpeg3cat concatenates elementary streams or demultiplexes a program stream (separates components of the stream).

sect3.title: mpeg3dump
sect3.para: mpeg3dump dumps information or extracts audio to a 24 bit PCM file.

sect3.title: mpeg3toc
sect3.para: mpeg3toc creates a table of contents for a DVD or MPEG stream.
